definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding

sentences.english: In the next three months this relationship took on a more flagrant form.
sentences.chinese: 在以后的三个月里，这种关系显得更加彰明较著了。

definition: dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style
to probe deeply and uncover minute details
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
to distinguish good and evil (idiom); to uphold virtue and condemn evil/to praise good and expose vice
start and development/thread (of a story)/general outline/clue
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
